content.text:
Absolutely—here are the outlines, subject lines, preview text, and the calendar updates. I also prepared Slack reminder commands you can paste to set 10am reminders for each weekly deadline.

Brief outlines (W1–W3)
- W1: Onboarding quick wins (CTA: book a demo)
  - Hook: Why the first 14 days decide retention
  - 3–5 quick wins: welcome email, checklist, first value path, milestone nudge, in-app tips
  - Mini case: lift from a recent cohort
  - Add: “demo to tailor onboarding” CTA
- W2: CFO interview (CTA: download budgeting template)
  - Intro: 2025 budgeting pressures (efficiency, ROI)
  - Q&A themes: must-have metrics, payback windows, cost controls, tooling consolidation
  - Framework: how to pitch spend internally
  - Resource: budgeting template CTA
- W3: Churn-reduction case study (CTA: read full case)
  - Baseline: churn problem and segments
  - Interventions: onboarding tweaks, lifecycle messaging, feature adoption cues
  - Results: churn delta, ARR saved
  - How-to: steps to replicate; deeper case CTA

Subject lines and preview text (all 6 weeks)
- W1: Subject: 5 onboarding quick wins that move your retention now | Preview: A 14‑day plan with templates—plus a demo to tailor it to your funnel.
- W2: Subject: CFO POV: How to budget for 2025 growth | Preview: A candid interview + a plug‑and‑play budgeting template.
- W3: Subject: Case study: How we cut churn by 18% in one quarter | Preview: Tactics, metrics, and the playbook—read the full breakdown.
- W4: Subject: Deep dive: Launching our new feature (with setup guide) | Preview: Why we built it, best practices, and how to try it today.
- W5: Subject: The 2025 tool roundup: what to keep, cut, or replace | Preview: Side‑by‑side comparisons to help you choose with confidence.
- W6: Subject: Your 2025 planning checklist (ready to copy) | Preview: Goals, metrics, ops, and headcount—all in one checklist.
